verses.verse: As snow <WH7950> in summer <WH7019>, and as rain <WH4306> in harvest <WH7105>, so honour <WH3519> is not seemly <WH5000> for a fool <WH3684>.
As the bird <WH6833> by wandering <WH5110> <WH8800>, as the swallow <WH1866> by flying <WH5774> <WH8800>, so the curse <WH7045> causeless <WH2600> shall not come <WH935> <WH8799>.
A whip <WH7752> for the horse <WH5483>, a bridle <WH4964> for the ass <WH2543>, and a rod <WH7626> for the fool's <WH3684> back <WH1460>.
Answer <WH6030> <WH8799> not a fool <WH3684> according to his folly <WH200>, lest thou also be like <WH7737> <WH8799> unto him.
Answer <WH6030> <WH8798> a fool <WH3684> according to his folly <WH200>, lest he be wise <WH2450> in his own conceit <WH5869>.
He that sendeth <WH7971> <WH8802> a message <WH1697> by the hand <WH3027> of a fool <WH3684> cutteth off <WH7096> <WH8764> the feet <WH7272>, and drinketh <WH8354> <WH8802> damage <WH2555>.
The legs <WH7785> of the lame <WH6455> are not equal <WH1809> <WH8804>: so is a parable <WH4912> in the mouth <WH6310> of fools <WH3684>.
As he that bindeth <WH6872> <WH8675> <WH6887> <WH8800> a stone <WH68> in a sling <WH4773>, so is he that giveth <WH5414> <WH8802> honour <WH3519> to a fool <WH3684>.
As a tshofar <WH2336> goeth up <WH5927> <WH8804> into the hand <WH3027> of a drunkard <WH7910>, so is a parable <WH4912> in the mouth <WH6310> of fools <WH3684>.
The great <WH7227> 'Elohim that formed <WH2342> <WH8789> all things both rewardeth <WH7936> <WH8802> the fool <WH3684>, and rewardeth <WH7936> <WH8802> transgressors <WH5674> <WH8802>.
As a dog <WH3611> returneth <WH7725> <WH8804> to his vomit <WH6892>, so a fool <WH3684> returneth <WH8138> <WH8802> to his folly <WH200>.
Seest <WH7200> <WH8804> thou a man <WH376> wise <WH2450> in his own conceit <WH5869>? there is more hope <WH8615> of a fool <WH3684> than of him.
The slothful <WH6102> man saith <WH559> <WH8804>, There is a lion <WH7826> in the way <WH1870>; a lion <WH738> is in the streets <WH7339>.
As the door <WH1817> turneth <WH5437> <WH8735> upon his hinges <WH6735>, so doth the slothful <WH6102> upon his bed <WH4296>.
The slothful <WH6102> hideth <WH2934> <WH8804> his hand <WH3027> in his bosom <WH6747>; it grieveth <WH3811> <WH8738> him to bring it again <WH7725> <WH8687> to his mouth <WH6310>.
The sluggard <WH6102> is wiser <WH2450> in his own conceit <WH5869> than seven men <WH7651> that can render <WH7725> <WH8688> a reason <WH2940>.
He that passeht by <WH5674> <WH8802>, and meddleth <WH5674> <WH8693> with strife <WH7379> belonging not to him, is like one that taketh <WH2388> <WH8688> a dog <WH3611> by the ears <WH241>.
As a mad <WH3856> <WH8700> man who casteth <WH3384> <WH8802> firebrands <WH2131>, arrows <WH2671>, and death <WH4194>,
So is the man <WH376> that deceiveth <WH7411> <WH8765> his neighbour <WH7453>, and saith <WH559> <WH8804>, Am not I in sport <WH7832> <WH8764> ?
Where no <WH657> wood <WH6086> is, there the fire <WH784> goeth out <WH3518> <WH8799>: so where there is no talebearer <WH5372>, the strife <WH4066> ceaseht <WH8367> <WH8799>.
As coals <WH6352> are to burning coals <WH1513>, and wood <WH6086> to fire <WH784>; so is a contentious <WH4079> <WH8675> <WH4066> man <WH376> to kindle <WH2787> <WH8771> strife <WH7379>.
The words <WH1697> of a talebearer <WH5372> are as wounds <WH3859> <WH8693>, and they go down <WH3381> <WH8804> into the innermost parts <WH2315> of the belly <WH990>.
Burning <WH1814> <WH8801> lips <WH8193> and a wicked <WH7451> heart <WH3820> are like a potsherd <WH2789> covered <WH6823> <WH8794> with silver <WH3701> dross <WH5509>.
He that hateth <WH8130> <WH8802> dissembleth <WH5234> <WH8735> with his lips <WH8193>, and layeth up <WH7896> <WH8799> deceit <WH4820> within <WH7130> him;
When he speaketh <WH6963> fair <WH2603> <WH8762>, believe <WH539> <WH8686> him not: for there are seven <WH7651> abominations <WH8441> in his heart <WH3820>.
Whose hatred <WH8135> is covered <WH3680> <WH8691> by deceit <WH4860>, his wickedness <WH7451> shall be shewed <WH1540> <WH8735> before the whole congregation <WH6951>.
Whoso diggeth <WH3738> <WH8802> a pit <WH7845> shall fall <WH5307> <WH8799> therein: and he that rolleth <WH1556> <WH8802> a stone <WH68>, it will return <WH7725> <WH8799> upon him.
A lying <WH8267> tongue <WH3956> hateth <WH8130> <WH8799> those that are afflicted <WH1790> by it; and a flattering <WH2509> mouth <WH6310> worketh <WH6213> <WH8799> ruin <WH4072>.
